title: Drawing, 1862–64
medium: Recto: Graphite, pen and black and brown ink on off-white wove paper
markings: Stamped in faded ink, at lower right: "Museum for the Arts of Decoration, Cooper Union."
inscribed: Recto: Inscribed in graphite, in vertical orientation, between boots: "high Light." Verso: Inscribed in graphite, along left margin: (113).
creditline: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
description: Recto:  Vertical view of the lower legs of man wearing knee-high boots and standing in grass; a sheathed sword hangs behind his legs; verso: foreshortened view of a man, with closed eyes, wearing a hat and lying on ground.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1862–64.
1862–64. Recto: Graphite, pen and black and brown ink on off-white wove paper. Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.. 1912-12-113.
